Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a double-convex body and a leaf-shaped lug on each side. The filling-hole is surrounded by a double moulding. The long splayed nozzle has a curved tip and a flat top; on each side of the top is a raised ridge ending in volutes on the shoulder; between these ridges is a beribboned thyrsos. The shoulder is decorated with ivy tendrils in relief, above a single moulding just above the carination. Within the base-ring is a nine-petalled rosette in relief. Covered with a red slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q594.bis)
